title: Music Cover Contest - Sponsored by Logitech!

replies.body: Is it at all possible to be given instrumental versions of the songs? Worth a shot aha
I agree. having the original instrumental versions would help with how some people would want to cover each song.
Why do the contest rules say you have to be 18 or over but the master rules say 13 or over?

It likely has to do with the specifics of the contest such as the nature of the prizes, the copyright stuff and who knows what else. The master rules are basically a template, so they would be superceded by the contest rules I imagine.

I know it's already been stated that the stems wont be provided, but would it be possible to get the sheet music and tabs? I've been trying to find something I can work with, but basically every site I've checked needs a subscription and/or disabled ad-blocker to use, and looking up tutorials on YouTube wont work with the "concept" I've chosen to pursue. Having the sheet music and tabs would be a great help.

Don't mind me. Just here, waiting for a response.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Heya HertVine,

We won't be providing sheet music but if you're after tabs/chord progression then do a quick google search for the track with the keyword "chords" and there's a bunch of sites where you can grab all this (e.g Ultimate Guitar Tabs, Chordify, Musescore etc).

Unfortunately, that doesn't help me in the slightest. Even searching for the chords (which are of little, if any, use to me, as I can't effectively "translate" them the way I need to), I still encounter the same issues I've experienced with everything else. I still get a bunch of websites that either require a subscription, or require a disabled ad-blocker, neither of which I'm willing to oblige for a website I don't know/trust just to access one thing, *if* they even have anything on the song in the first place.

At this point, I am completely unable to do *anything* to make progress as I have nothing to work from other than just listening to the song itself, and I seriously lack the ability to "recreate" it as such (particularly with the "alterations" I was hoping to use), let alone to do so with such little time available.
Just a little unclear as to what classifies as a cover, do you want the same music (score) as the original or the same lyrics or both?

They're looking for original recordings (hence why sheet music and instrumentals aren't provided). You can remix the lyrics however you want, and use whatever style you want, it just basically has to still be recognisable as one of those three songs.
Okay, thought so, I just didn't want to do something then have is not count.

~~Am I able to collaborate with a friend or two if we each have specialties? ~~wait a minute i missed that part in the rules
And in addition to that, if part of my...idk band? If one member was under 18 for example, would they still be able to participate?
Hey Iownfish, unfortunately if you're entering as a band, you'll all need to be over 18 for this particular comp.
These songs are too soft for me (light bringer is not my tonal range either) ugh I really wanted to enter too oh well good luck to those entering
Hey Alease, as it's a cover you should change the song to suit you! I'd love to hear a version of Amumu in a completely different style.

Why does it have to be over 18
:(
can i enter even if im under 18 tho?

I made a submission but after submitting my entry, I realized that there is a small error with the recording. Is it possible to cancel the first entry and resubmit?

extra* I have just re-submitted the final copy. Is it okay if the authority withdraw my first entry? Thank you in advance.

Heya MoarCoffee - can confirm we received your entry! Best of luck with the competition, the finalists announcement is on Monday.

:-)
M

Hi Smoothie,

Apologies for the delayed response - I can confirm we received your entry! Good luck for the rest of the competition, we'll be announcing finalists on Monday.

:-)

Another question - Nothing too risque or violent in nature; Say I'm converting Lightbringer into a rap, reusing their lyrics (which is already a dark violent theme), would this be allowed? Assuming I don't go into specifics and use curses, I'm simply extending their story.
If you're covering Lightbringer as a rap and want to extend that / change it to suit the style then go for it! Be as creative as you like, but keep it clean! GLHF!
Rip I thought it ended on the 26th went to go upload it XD Ive been sick for the past week while I was trying to record haha oh well missed out.
Aw that sucks. :/ I was paranoid about missing the date so I put up a little sticky-note (yes, people still use those >.>) on my monitor. xD

I know I couldn't be any later to ask this question but would I be able to include original lyrics inbetween verses for example on amumu's theme. Where there is a pause between verse 1 and verse 2 could I add some original lyrics in there?
Also, do I have to actually remake the instrumental or do I use the original song and just add my lyrics over the top?

The first one I'm not sure on but I want to say no (assuming you mean using part of the original song, as opposed to just the original words) for the same reason as the answer to your second. They're looking for original recordings for this contest, so you can't use the original instrumental.
GAH, I only just heard about this, I think I could get a track up quick, are we allowed to use MIDI recording? What would we link aswell, the bounced audio to youtube or soundcloud? What's best?
We are only allowed to use the 3 MP3 tracks they provide as material. Anything else has to be selfmade (instrumental or electronic). Upload song to Youtube.

School doesn't start again for a couple days longer so I won't be able to send in anything with my group, we did Amumu for credits :(((((

BUT, on the bright side, maybe I can send in something solo lol I wonder how many people are doing novice recorder covers..gl to any contestants then

Hi there,

I just wanted to confirm that my link is playable for you guys? When I initially uploaded it, it was set to private, and no one could get it to work. It works now as I've since set it to public. :)

If you're using youtube, the option you're looking for is unlisted. Basically Private is on the channel but visible only to you, unlisted is visible only with a link to the video, and Public is visible to anyone through searches or on your channel page etc.
Someone has to make a j-pop version of The Curse Of The Sad Mummy, It would be amazing.
Oh that would sound awesome. :O
What would happen if I have a family member enter for me on their own behalf with my cover song?

Refer to contest rules:

> Your entry must be made by you, submitted by you, and made specifically for this contest: this is about YOU showcasing YOUR artistic talents specifically for this contest. You may elect to submit this entry as a group (E.G a band) or solo.
Rip, I guess I have to stop continuing on the work then.

Not necessarily.

If the "issue" is that you, personally, don't meet one of the requirements (for example, the age limit), then yes, you wouldn't be able to enter.

*However*, if it's just that you want someone else to enter on your behalf (for whatever other reason), then you can continue the work and have that individual get involved with the process of creating the cover, hence making them part of your "band", and they will then be able to enter on behalf of your "group".
Still can't as I'm working on a solo piece.
Does it have to be great singing? Or do meme-y songs count?

I'm going to let you in on a little "secret".

I can't sing for sh!t.

However, I'm going to use that to my advantage, and try for a "grungy" style with it.

Really, these kinds of things are about expressing yourself. If you want to do a "meme-y" song, go for it. I'm sure some of the Rioters will appreciate it (whether it get's short-listed is another thing).
I would really love to compete for this but under 18 so I can't....

Hi!

When we upload to Youtube, can it be public or should it be a private link that only people WITH the link (i.e the contest judges) can view/listen to? :)
Hey Krice, Public is fine! GL!
Ah, great! Thanks very much for the reply. :)
Is using a program like FL Studio to make a cover allowed?
Heya, you can use whatever you like to record your covers, as long as they're original recordings!
So it doesn't matter if we can't play an instruement for the cover? We just need to be able to create a recording?
Electronic music is cool as long as it's an original recording (ie not using stems / any part of the original piece) then you're more than welcome to enter!
wait can i do an instrumental only for one of the tracks without singing? i cant sing..
